com.hazelcast.monitor.impl

Class GlobalPerIndexStats

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.monitor.impl.GlobalPerIndexStats
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PerIndexStats

    public class GlobalPerIndexStats
extends Object
implements PerIndexStats
    The implementation of internal index stats specialized for global indexes.

    The main trait of the implementation is the concurrency support, which is required for global indexes because they are shared among partitions.

      • Fields inherited from interface com.hazelcast.monitor.impl.PerIndexStats

    • Constructor Detail

      • GlobalPerIndexStats

        public GlobalPerIndexStats(boolean ordered,
                           boolean usesCachedQueryableEntries)
        Constructs a new instance of global index stats.
        Parameters:
        ordered - true if the stats are being created for an ordered index, false otherwise. Affects the on-heap memory cost calculation.
        usesCachedQueryableEntries - true if the stats are being created for an index for which queryable entries are cached, false otherwise. Affects the on-heap memory cost calculation.

        Returns a new timestamp.

        Used for latency measurement, expressed in nanoseconds.

        Specified by:

      • getCreationTime

        public long getCreationTime()
        Description copied from interface: PerIndexStats
        Returns the creation time of the index.

        The value is relative to midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC and expressed in milliseconds.

        Specified by:
        getCreationTime in interface PerIndexStats

      • getQueryCount

        public long getQueryCount()
        Description copied from interface: PerIndexStats
        Returns the total number of queries served by the index.

        The returned value may be less than the one returned by PerIndexStats.getHitCount() since a single query may hit the same index more than once.

        Specified by:
        getQueryCount in interface PerIndexStats

      • getTotalNormalizedHitCardinality

        public double getTotalNormalizedHitCardinality()
        Description copied from interface: PerIndexStats
        Returns the total normalized cardinality of the hits served by the index.

        Normalized hit cardinality is calculated as hit_cardinality / entry_count at the time of the hit. The returned value is a sum of all individual normalized hit cardinalities.

        Specified by:
        getTotalNormalizedHitCardinality in interface PerIndexStats

        Specified by:

      • getTotalInsertLatency

        public long getTotalInsertLatency()
        Description copied from interface: PerIndexStats
        Returns the total latency (in nanoseconds) of insert operations performed on the index.

        To compute the average latency divide the returned value by insert operation count.

        Specified by:
        getTotalInsertLatency in interface PerIndexStats

      • getMemoryCost

        public long getMemoryCost()
        Description copied from interface: PerIndexStats
        Returns the memory cost of the index in bytes.

        Currently, for on-heap indexes (OBJECT and BINARY storages), the returned value is just a best-effort approximation and doesn't indicate a precise on-heap memory usage of the index.

        Specified by:
        getMemoryCost in interface PerIndexStats

      • onIndexHit

        public void onIndexHit(long timestamp,
                       long hitCardinality)
        Description copied from interface: PerIndexStats
        Invoked by the associated index after every index hit.

        Following operations generate a hit:

        • Index.getRecords(Comparable)
        • Index.getRecords(Comparable[])
        • Index.getSubRecords
        • Index.getSubRecordsBetween
        Specified by:
        onIndexHit in interface PerIndexStats
        Parameters:
        timestamp - the time at which the hit-producing operation was started.
        hitCardinality - the cardinality of the hit.
        See Also:
        PerIndexStats.makeTimestamp()
